column4: How can I create wireless ad hoc network using the command line?
sudo iwconfig eth1 essid "My Network" && sudo iwconfig eth1 mode Ad-Hoc

ActionParsnip, binMonkey , Can you do something about this : I use wvdial to connect to internet through GPRS usb modem. Now when I try to connect/create a wirless lan through Network manager, I am unable to use that GPRS internet
You mean if you setup a wireless ad-hoc network it disconnects you from the GPRS connection
Otherwise what you want to do is setup a wireless ad-hoc connection in networkmanager with the IPv4 settings set to "Share connection" and it'll automatically set it up for you
Exactly. I can't say it disconnects me, but the internet just don't work
Yeah, try configuring the ad-hoc connection settings to tell network manager you're using it to share another connection
I am doing that only, not working
When I create a wireless connection and connect to it, my wvdial connection doesn't work.
I guess the problem is you're not doing it all through network manager
You either have to use network manager for everything or don't use it at all
I am doing the wvdial though CLI, and wireless through network connection
because the GPRS doesnt' work from NM
Hrm, it should work in 9.10 at least
Do you suggest me to connect both GPRS as well as ad hoc from CLI. I am using *9.04
You'll have to setup both from CLI then, which gets...fun
You have to set the wireless mode, channel, and name then give it an IP, configure routes, iptables, etc
can you point out to an article for that
Nope, I don't even know how to do it all
So thats where the catch is!
I'd suggest upgrading to 9.10 and seeing if you can do your GPRS connection in network manager again
I have the 9.10 disk. I was just needing a reason to upgrade ;)
